properties.name: 12/26/2006: DJ WICKED and DJ O.G. ONE official ADIDAS Shoe Launch Party...
properties.description: Posted by Jake 231 SW Ankeny, Portland, OR(10 SW 3rd Avenue, corner of SW 3rd and Ankeny) 9PM...21 & UP....Cover TBA. Portland HipHop icons DJ WICKED and DJ O.G. ONE will soon be sporting their very own, limited edition, signature, Adidas brand sneakers as part of a national shoe campaign focused on creating custom kicks for some of the most influential DJ\'s in the industry. Only a handful of DJ\'s from across the nation have been honored with the opportunity to participate in this exclusive sneaker program. Amongst the few, DJ WICKED and O.G. ONE are the coveted two DJ\'s that have been selected to represent for the State of Oregon. HipHop legends such as Funkmaster Flex and DJ Clue are also part of the elite chosen to claim their very own custom Adidas kicks. So, where can you find these exclusive sneakers? Word is that they will only be available in limited stock at the "Lifted" shoe boutique (located at 2415 NE Broadway Portland, Oregon). Be one of the first to peep the sneaks on December 26th @ Berbati\'s for the official DJ WICKED/DJ O.G. ONE Adidas shoe launch party, where you\'ll have a chance to check out the new custom kicks first hand, while listening to the sounds of the DJ\'s that represent them.

properties.name: 5th Avenue Court - 9/11
properties.description: Posted by JakeHeatboy woke me up with an early phone call, saying \'oh my god, turn on the news, we\'ve been attacked!!!\' ARE YOU KIDDING ME? WHAT ARE YOU TALKING ABOUT??? \'TURN ON CNN RIGHT NOW!\' I called my father as I was in shock as to what I was seeing and could not make sense of it. He told me to just keep an eye on the news, and chill out on work, we\'ll know more later. Of course, the buildings hadn\'t fallen yet, the Pentagon hadn\'t been hit, and there was still the other plane, which led to days of a frazzled Aaron Brown giving me the scoop

properties.name: A really big crater
properties.description: Posted by JakeScientists have discovered a huge crater in the Saharan desert, the largest one ever found there. The crater is about 19 miles (31 kilometers) wide, more than twice as big as the next largest Saharan crater known. It utterly dwarfs Meteor Crater in Arizona, which is about three-fourths of a mile (1.2 kilometers) in diameter....

properties.name: DEPT. WINTER BREAK SKATE CAMP WITH BEEBS DEC. 18-21ST!!!
properties.description: Posted by Jake  15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORHey Everyone, Winter Break is coming up and The Dept. is going to be offering a week of Skate Camp from Dec. 18th-21st. Many of you may have attended one of our Summer Skate Camps over the last 4 years and at times may have been unable to get into them because they are sold out, so for the first time ever we\'ve added a winter week to the Holiday schedule. We\'re bumping the available slots up to the first 40 skaters to sign up so act fast because they fill up quick. The camp is open to anyone 6 yrs and older and any level of ability. Any skater can get something out of a week of Skate Camp and our Skoaches (Skate Coaches) are really cool guys who are down to help you in any way they can. For the first time as well, Girl Skateboards Pro, Dept. pal, and all around great-guy Brandon Biebel will be stopping by the last day of camp to hang out, have fun, and challenge any takers to a game of S.K.A.T.E. If you missed him at the Matix demo 2 months ago, here\'s your chance to see him again up close and personal. The cost is 50.00 for the week of camp. Camp runs 9:00am-Noon Monday thru Thursday and campers can stay and skate the first 2 public sessions for free. Call The Dept. (503.493.9480) to hold your space. There is a 0.00 deposit required to hold a space and the balance is due the first day of camp. Dept. Winter Skate Camp is a great thing to do during your break and makes a great early Christmas gift. See you then. -The Dept.

properties.name: End of the Skaterace - National GO SKATEBOARDING Day
properties.description: Posted by Jake  End of the RaceMake sure to head over to the Dept after this. The Mt. Tabor to Waterfront Skaterace- Meet at the top of Mt. Tabor at 9:00AM for this kickoff event. The route will go down Mt.Tabor to 60th Ave and then continue down SE Hawthorne from 60th to the Eastside Waterfront. Signs will mark the way to the starting point and then just follow the mob down. You can take this race as seriously as you\'d like to show you\'re one of the fastest shredders in Portland, or just show up as a participant in an event that will definitely stop traffic and make a statement to everyone on the street. We want to get as many people out to do this as possible. (Some suggestions for the race: Carpool/ride the bus to the starting point so you don\'t have to leave your car at Mt. Tabor. Try and show up as close to 9:00am as possible so that you don\'t get left behind the group. If possible, line up 2 cars: one to leave down near Eastside Waterfront and take one up to Tabor. After the race, cruise back up and retrieve that car. You\'ll work it out.

properties.name: First Friday - Chris Haberman
properties.description: Posted by Jake500 NW Couch St, portlandI have a couple of art shows this Friday (Dec 1) if you are around the neighborhood. I appreciate any and all support that I have from my friends, family and super kewl patrons that have walked into my life. Everybody is so awesome to me about this stuff. I sold over half of my paintings displayed in November (over 50!) and I completed a window mural at a comic shop (Floating World Comics, 5th NW Couch, in Portland Art Center building, www.floatingworldcomics.com. – TOTALLY kewl place, only comic shop downtown p-town) – it will be up until the Spring so go check it (I doubt the magic markers and Copenhagen tins I used to make it will last through our harsh Portland winter).

properties.name: Good eats
properties.description: Posted by Christine5714 SE Powell Blvd, Portland, OR, 97206I heard about this sushi restaurant from a co-worker. This place is actually only a few blocks from my house. Ichidai is tucked away inside a plain office complex. We\'ve driven by it for a year and a half -- never knowing the good eats that were right behind the rice paper screens. Ichidai offers delicious sushi, very fresh, and inexpensive. The pickled ginger was especially fresh. I\'ve read that the service is slow, but for us, the staff was plenty attentive.

properties.name: Goodfoot Art Opening
properties.description: Posted by Jake The Goodfoot will have an art opening on Last Thurs, Jan 25th, from 5-11pm.  The show will have various styles, but all based in collage.  The artists are Edward Story, Israel Hughes, Luke Dolkas, Lori Olds, and Tim Livingston.  The show will be up until Feb. 20. Edward Story’s work is about images and disjointed fragments.  He uses collage in combination with other techniques to change and disrupt the usual meaning or "reading" associated with certain imagery.  He’s lived in Portland since 1999 and have shown locally since then.  He has work in private collections as well as some public venues.   Oregon born artist, Israel Hughes, studied art at the San Francisco Art Institue, Cornish School of Fine Arts in Seattle, and received a degree in Art Education at Western Oregon State College.  His collages have been exhibited nationally and internationally, and his works are in two public collections.  Israel\'s approach to collage is using juxtaposition and multiplications of layers to guide the viewer\'s attention towards building a visual map of the constantly changing environment of the urban landscape and the alientation the individual experiences. Luke Dolkas has been a living artist for twelve years, over ten of which have been right here in Portland, Oregon.  He works primarily in mixed-media, collage, painting, and drawing--however he has been seen taking photographs, experimenting with printmaking, and fooling around with assemblage.  "My work has a dazzling sense of nothingness, mixed with a dash of irony and nostalgia.". Lori Olds has been doing collage of some sort for about 8 years now. What started out as crafty fun eventually evolved into a sort of embellished/mixed media style of collage and then became more refined using only paper and getting more involved with layering and use of lighting, texture, tone and color to create as seamless of an image as possible. The goal being that it should look like it was meant to be it\'s own image before she cut things up to create it. If you can\'t figure out where the separate pieces begin and end, then she feels she has done a good job as far as how she crafted it, and she loves that challenge - which is much like putting together a puzzle, but without the picture on the box to guide you. Tim Livingston aka fog vs. fist was born in ohio, and raised in California, he died in Oregon and was reborn in the West Indies.

properties.name: HABERMAN ART - Saturday, October 14, 5 – 9 pm
properties.description: Posted by Jake 1520 se 7th portland or 97214Just an innocent art show reminder. If you happen to be around SE Portland this Saturday evening, stop by and say hello. I have a buncha new work and I really like the walls of this joint (multi color…oohh la la). Invite attached. Info also below with commentary. Saturday, October 14, 5 – 9 pm (Roots Brewery, (1520 SE Seventh Ave Portland, off Hawthorne). Showing (30) paintings for this Autumn opening show, entitled “Young Man Like You, Drunk By Noon” – newly selected works of Chris Haberman. Show runs from Oct. 14 – Nov. 14. Come by and have an “organic” pint from this totally colorful (and independent) local organic brewery. They also feature a Jalapeno beer and the taps are made from Dragonboat paddles. It’s also non-smoking for anyone that happens to be kinda healthy (except for beer drinking of course).

properties.name: IPATH TEAM DROPPING BY THE DEPT. THIS THURSDAY SEP. 21ST!
properties.description: Posted by Jake 15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORThe Ipath team is on a little filming mission up here in the Northwest and the guys are going to be dropping by The Dept. tomorrow around 4:00. Their crew includes: Matt Rodriguez, Bobby Puleo, Quim Cardona, Kenny Reed, Fred Gall, Nilton Neves, and Barker Barrett. These guys are skater\'s skaters and really just want to session, so what we\'re doing is giving you a chance to skate with them. Here\'s the deal: The 3:30-6:30 session tomorrow (Thursday Sept. 21st) is going to be free to skate for anyone who shows up. The Ipath guys will be here skating as well and the session should be going off. You have to be signed up at The Dept. to ride, but if you already have that covered, come down and skate for free from 3:30-6:30. We\'ll be resuming the regularly scheduled session starting at 6:30. Let all your buddies know and make sure to come by The Dept. tomorrow. Your Pals, -The Dept.

properties.name: Jon Humphries Photo Show @ Cal's Pharmacy Dec. 30th!!!
properties.description: Posted by Jake    15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORHey Everyone! Saturday, December 30th, Cal\'s Pharmacy is proud to host a photography show by our very own Portland local gone big time: Jon Humphries. If you don\'t know who Humphries is, let me fill you in: he\'s the ripping-ist skateboard photographer ever. (my humble opinion). He has shot with everyone and for everyone: Transworld, The Skateboard Mag, Danny Way, Arto, P-Rod, T-Hawk, etc. The guy is top notch. Don\'t miss your chance to say what\'s up to Jon and see a new collection of never seen before prints, polaroids and other photographic works of wizardry that he has put together for his custom installation here at Cals Pharmacy. Opening reception: Saturday Dec. 30th 7pm-10pm Cals Pharmacy 11 NE Hancock St. Portland, OR 97217 503-233-1237 Thanks, peace, and Merry Christmas to all...

properties.name: La Luna (RIP)
properties.description: Posted by Jake 221 SE 9th ave, portland, oregonSo many great shows were seen here. ATCQ, De la soul, souls of mischief (all on one bill) in 1993. A classic moment to be remembered was when Wyclef from the little known Fugees ripped local freestyler Byron Brown a new one in front of the club while US3 was playing inside. Byron had a clothing company called Urban Soul Food (USF) and was decked out in it. Misunderstanding USF to be USAF, Wyclef clowned him on some air force type thing. I don\'t remember the full scoop. Saw Digitial Underground, Pharcyde, Big Daddy Kane, House of Pain, lots of punk shows (Hazel, Crackerbash). I pretty much spent every weekend here.

properties.name: Lost World
properties.description: Posted by JakeFoja MountainsTo boldly go where no one has gone before, one group of scientists didn\'t have to venture into space. They found a lost world right here on Earth. "It really was like crossing some sort of time warp into a place that people hadn\'t been to," said Bruce Beehler of the wildlife expedition he co-led in December into the isolated Foja Mountains on the tropical South Pacific island of New Guinea.

properties.name: Music Genome Project and Pandora
properties.description: Posted by Jake 801 NW 23rd, portland, oregonTim Westergren (founder of Pandora): As some of you know, I will be hitting the road this year in search of great new music to add to the Music Genome Project and Pandora. My first stop: Portland, Oregon. While I\'m there, I\'ll be checking out open mics and picking the brains of local music insiders to learn as much as I can about Portland\'s thriving music scene. The event is slated to begin at 6 p.m. at the Music Millennium at 801 NW 23rd Street.

properties.name: Snowball fight ends in stabbing in SE Portland
properties.description: Posted by Jake4800 SE Woodstock, PortlandWell, not really murder: An errant snowball led to a stabbing in southeast Portland Tuesday afternoon, police said. About 1 p.m., officers arriving at the 4800 block of SEWoodstock Boulevard found 17-year-old Timothy Ray Garcia with a stab wound to his upper body. Police arrested 36-year-old John Preston Grant for assault. Witnesses told officers that the victim and a group of friends were throwing snowballs at each other when one of the snowballs struck a moving vehicle driven by the suspect. The suspect got out of his vehicle and started a fight with the group, which escalated to a stabbing. He then drove off but returned a short time later and turned himself in to officers at the scene. Garcia was transported to a local hospital with non life-threatening injuries.

properties.name: Sphinx

properties.name: Start - The Mt. Tabor to Waterfront Skaterace
properties.description: Posted by JakeTop o\' Mt. TaborMeet at the top of Mt. Tabor at 9:00AM for this kickoff event. The route will go down Mt.Tabor to 60th Ave and then continue down SE Hawthorne from 60th to the Eastside Waterfront. Signs will mark the way to the starting point and then just follow the mob down. You can take this race as seriously as you\'d like to show you\'re one of the fastest shredders in Portland, or just show up as a participant in an event that will definitely stop traffic and make a statement to everyone on the street. We want to get as many people out to do this as possible. (Some suggestions for the race: Carpool/ride the bus to the starting point so you don\'t have to leave your car at Mt. Tabor. Try and show up as close to 9:00am as possible so that you don\'t get left behind the group. If possible, line up 2 cars: one to leave down near Eastside Waterfront and take one up to Tabor. After the race, cruise back up and retrieve that car. You\'ll work it out.

properties.name: The art of Musical Maintenance III
properties.description: Posted by Jake The Art of Musical Maintenance, in it’s 3rd year, is proud to display the newest installment of music posters from artists throughout the country. The artists in this show are as diverse as the music. Likewise, the artist’s techniques vary as well (from hand drawn to cut and paste designs). There are over 40 artists, and over 250 posters. Along with the poster show, we will have a diverse line up of musicians playing in the downstairs. DJ\'s: ERS1, monkeytek, Jon El Dante Bands: Bastinado, Bronson, and Scott Permberton/ Joe Cunningham / Jeff Baxter / and special Guests It will be an eventful evening both up and downstairs. Hope to see you at the opening. Jason SHOW OPEN’S LAST THURSDAY NOVEMBER 30, 2006 show up until January 23rd 2007 THE GOODFOOT 2845 SE Stark www.thegoodfoot.com 503.239.9292 (check website after day of opening for a full catalog of art available) www.thegoodfoot.com/amm3 Artists Alan Hynes Ames Bros Austin Sellers Brian Methe Casey Burns Chuck U Craig Horky Cricket Press Dan Stiles EMEK Furturtle Gary Houston Guyburwell Jason Brown Jesse Philips John Howard Jonathan Moran Lee Zeman Leia Bell Lil Tuffy Lindsey Kuhn Manny Roldan Mark McCormick Michael Hammond Mike King Mike Klay Mike Martin Modo Nat Damm Nathan Duval Patent Pending Reno Galaxy Rob Servo Sasha Barr Spike Press Stainboy Steven Cerio Tara McPherson Tim Livingston Tom Deja Tomas Aguilar Uncle Charlie

properties.name: The art of Musical Maintenance III (CONTINUED)
properties.description: Posted by Jake The art of musical maintenance III will continue for another month, instead our normal monthly change up for last thursday. There will be a few new posters added though (with as many posters as there are, you will probably find a lot that you didn\'t notice before). We will also be running a one night only special on Dec. 28th Last thursday; All FRAMED POSTERS WILL BE 0 OFF. If you haven\'t had a chance to check it out, you wont be disappointed. Happy Holiday\'s. Hope to see you down there.

properties.name: Urban Hike
properties.description: Posted by Symplvision   Go to this place and try a 10 mile urban hike. You can read about this project on my web site. It\'s 30 laps around the block. Look for the paper clips on the chain link fence. These mark the number of laps. Bring your own though! After you do this, email me with pics, writing, scans, songs, or whatever you want to document your experience. I predict you will have a meditative journey, and you will be surprised by what happens. Thanks

properties.name: VOLCOM WILD IN THE PARKS CONTEST THIS SATURDAY AUG. 19TH!!
properties.description: Posted by Jake 15 Ne Hancock St, Portland, ORIn case you hadn\'t heard, The Dept. is hosting the Volcom Wild in the Parks Am Contest this Saturday August 19th. The contest is free to enter and has 2 divisions: 14 yrs. and under and 15 yrs. and over. The contest is a jam style format and should get started around noon. Registrations begins at 11:00am or you can pre-register on Volcom\'s website volcom.com. There will be prizes and giveaways, and free hotdogs until they\'re gone so make sure to come through early. THE DEPT. WILL NOT BE HAVING THE 10:00AM SESSION THIS SATURDAY BECAUSE OF THE CONTEST. WE APOLOGIZE FOR ANY INCONVENIENCE THIS MAY CAUSE. WE WILL RETURN TO NORMAL SESSION SCHEDULE FOLLOWING THE CONTEST. We definitely encourage everyone to come and enter. Entry is free so what do you have to lose?
